summary:
Islam is a religion with around 1.9 billion followers worldwide, making it the second-largest religion after Christianity. It was founded by the prophet Muhammad in Mecca, Saudi Arabia, in the year 610 CE. Muslims believe in one God and that Muhammad is His final prophet. The Quran, which Muslims believe is God's word, and the teachings of Muhammad are the main sources of Islamic belief.

Islam has two main branches: Sunni (85-90%) and Shia (10-15%). Its key practices include praying five times a day, giving to charity, fasting during Ramadan, and making a pilgrimage to Mecca. Muslims celebrate two main festivals, Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha.
title: Islam
